intro: Sida arbuscula, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida arbuscula is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its hairy foliage and showy flowers make it a distinctive and visually appealing plant in its native range.
